question_text: How do nano-sized metal oxide catalysts like CuO and Fe2O3 enhance the decomposition and combustion rates of RDX-based energetic compositions by modifying thermal properties and reaction mechanisms?
standard_answer: Nano-sized metal oxide catalysts such as CuO and Fe2O3 enhance the decomposition and combustion rates of RDX-based energetic compositions primarily through their high specific surface areas, which provide abundant active sites for catalytic interactions. These nanomaterials increase the decomposition rate, enhance the burning rate, and improve combustion efficiency by changing the thermal conductivity, energy barrier of thermolysis, heat of reaction, and gas-phase reaction mechanisms of the main ingredients. The catalytic effects manifest in both condensed and gas phases during decomposition and subsequent combustion via activation of reactants and acceleration of their transition state formations. Owing to their extremely large specific surface areas, nano-sized energetic additives have significant catalytic effects that promote more efficient heat release and faster reaction kinetics in RDX-based systems.
